intro: Othonna eckloneana, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Othonna eckloneana thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
